function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Congested academic and administrative buildings may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases due to close proximity and high occupancy.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission and outbreaks within the academic and administrative buildings, impacting the health and safety of students and staff.","Mitigation":"Implement social distancing measures, improve ventilation systems, and enforce strict hygiene protocols to reduce the risk of disease transmission.","Technologies":"Air purification systems, touchless fixtures, and monitoring systems for occupancy and social distancing compliance.","People":"Students, faculty, administrative staff","Owner":"University management and facilities management"},{"Description":"Inadequate parking facilities and overhanging structures may lead to congestion and close contact among vehicle occupants, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","Impact":"Higher likelihood of disease spread in congested parking areas, posing a health risk to individuals using the parking facilities.","Mitigation":"Expand parking capacity, enforce distancing guidelines for parked vehicles, and address overhanging structures to minimize close contact.","Technologies":"Smart parking solutions, automated entry/exit systems, and structural modifications to address overhanging.","People":"Students, faculty, visitors","Owner":"University management and facilities management"},{"Description":"Inadequate workshop facilities and limited space may impact the ability to implement proper hygiene and distancing measures, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","Impact":"Greater vulnerability to disease outbreaks within the workshops, posing a health risk to staff and students utilizing the facilities.","Mitigation":"Optimize workshop layout for distancing, install additional hygiene stations, and schedule staggered usage to reduce crowding.","Technologies":"Occupancy monitoring systems, enhanced ventilation, and sanitation stations.","People":"Workshop staff, students","Owner":"University management and facilities management"}]}
